url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/issues/1209' [713] heading 'Summary' [715] paragraph '' StaticText "This PR adds the WCAG level to each checklist item so it's easier to know what checks to prioritize when trying to make a site accessible." [716] heading 'Notes / Questions' [718] list '' [719] listitem '' ListMarker '‚Ä¢' StaticText 'Do you think that the placement of the new information is correct / the best way to display it? I tried putting it in the part of the checklist item that is always visible but there there was a concern with responsiveness and the full' [720] code '' StaticText 'Level: AAA' StaticText 'was taking too much space.' [721] listitem '' ListMarker '‚Ä¢' [722] link '@ericwbailey', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/ericwbailey' StaticText 'you' [723] link 'mentioned', url='https://github.com/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/issues/1209#issuecomment-799887433' StaticText "in the issue that some checklist items might represent multiple success criterions. At least from what I saw each checklist item has only one WCAG link and each of those links only had one WCAG level asociated. That being said, I know for a fact that for example there are different contrast requirements for different levels but those don't seems to be covered in the checklist, just mention the one for level AA that is the minimum. Any thoughts on this? do you think that it's ok as I put it?" [724] listitem '' ListMarker '‚Ä¢' StaticText 'There was one checklist item that linked to a WCAG technique instead of a "Understanding WCAG" rule and didn\'t have a level asociated to for that one I put' [725] code '' StaticText "Level: doesn't apply" StaticText '. I thought about putting nothing at all but then it would have looked like it was missing.' Fixed :)' [1319] listitem '' [1325] link 'Administrator', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/root' [1326] image 'Administrator', url='https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/e64c7d89f26bd1972efa854d13d7dd61?s=80&d=identicon' [1330] button 'Show thread' [1332] link 'Administrator', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/root' StaticText 'Administrator' [1335] link '@root', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/root' StaticText '@root' StaticText 'started a thread on an outdated change in commit' [1340] link 'f0c57cc5', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/merge_requests/1270' StaticText 'f0c57cc5' [1343] link '3 years ago', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/merge_requests/1270#note_301244' [1344] time 'May 10, 2021 1:45am EDT' StaticText '3 years ago' StaticText 'Last updated by' [1348] link 'EJ Mason', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/mxmason' [1349] time 'May 10, 2021 11:33am EDT' StaticText '3 years ago' [1350] listitem '' [1353] link 'Administrator', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/root' [1354] image 'Administrator', url='https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/e64c7d89f26bd1972efa854d13d7dd61?s=80&d=identicon' [1358] link 'Administrator', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/root' StaticText 'Administrator' [1361] link '@root', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/root' StaticText '@root' StaticText '¬∑' [1367] link '3 years ago', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/merge_requests/1270#note_302679' [1368] time 'May 10, 2021 1:46pm EDT' StaticText '3 years ago' StaticText 'Contributor' [1376] button '', hasPopup='menu', expanded=False [1381] button 'Reply to comment' [1383] button 'Edit comment' [1386] button 'More actions' [1405] paragraph '' [1406] emphasis '' StaticText 'Created by: scottaohara' [1407] paragraph '' StaticText "While I realize this content predates the work being done here (which all the work in this PR seems pretty great from what I've reviewed) I was reviewing the actual checklist content as well. There are some SCs that need to be updated as they are not accurately referenced, and I figured it would be better to just lump that all into this PR, rather than create any merge conflicts or what not." [1408] paragraph '' StaticText "So, here's the issues that jumped out at me when reviewing:" [1409] blockquote '' [1410] paragraph '' StaticText 'Make sure that button, a, and label element content is unique and descriptive.' [1411] paragraph '' StaticText "this is likely more a 2.4.4 issue for links (possibly 2.4.9 depending on context) and a 2.4.6 issue for labels... possibly buttons. It's a bit dicey putting these all together, but the point being that 1.3.1 doesn't really apply here. I'm not sure exactly what you want to do here, but I suggest at the very least removing the SC if you can't cite multiple SCs." [1412] blockquote '' [1413] paragraph '' StaticText 'Use landmark elements to indicate important content regions.' [1414] paragraph '' StaticText 'This would be a 1.3.1 issue. 4.1.2 is more about interactive content' [1415] blockquote '' [1416] paragraph '' StaticText 'Avoid using the autofocus attribute.' [1417] paragraph '' StaticText 'Generally agree with this, but arguable if this would be a 2.4.3 issue. Sometimes using' [1418] code '' StaticText 'autofocus' StaticText "is exactly what you should do. Might be worth at least stating this is something to watch out for, rather than how this presently reads (to me) that it's an autofail." [1419] blockquote '' [1420] paragraph '' StaticText 'Remove title attribute tooltips.' [1421] paragraph '' StaticText "This is arguably more of a 2.1.1 keyboard issue as - if the content is actually important - would generally be inaccessible to keyboard only users. since title is generally exposed to AT, 4.1.2 doesn't really hold true here." [1422] blockquote '' [1423] paragraph '' StaticText 'Check to see that keyboard focus order matches the visual layout.' [1424] paragraph '' StaticText "1.3.2 may not apply here as content doesn't necessarily need to match visual focus order. 2.4.3 may be more appropriate to cite." [1425] blockquote '' [1426] paragraph '' StaticText 'headings' [1427] paragraph '' StaticText 'All checklist items in the headings section incorrectly cite 2.4.6. 2.4.6 is about the quality of heading text, but has nothing to do with whether the text is properly exposed as a heading. These would all be 1.3.1/best practice issues.' [1428] blockquote '' [1429] paragraph '' StaticText 'Use the th element for table headers (with appropriate scope attributes).' [1430] paragraph '' StaticText 'Unsure why this is cited as a 4.1.1 issue. Seems it should be a 1.3.1' [1431] blockquote '' [1432] paragraph '' StaticText 'Use the caption element to provide a title for the table.' [1433] paragraph '' StaticText 'Again, not a 2.4.6' [1434] emphasis '' StaticText 'unless' StaticText 'there is a' [1435] code '' StaticText '' StaticText 'already implemented which has crummy text.' [1436] blockquote '' [1437] paragraph '' StaticText 'All inputs in a form are associated with a corresponding label element.' [1438] paragraph '' StaticText 'Not a 3.2.2 issue. Typo for 3.3.2?' [1439] blockquote '' [1440] paragraph '' StaticText 'Associate input error messaging with the input it corresponds to.' [1441] paragraph '' StaticText 'Should be 1.3.1 and/or 4.1.2.' [1442] blockquote '' [1443] paragraph '' StaticText 'Ensure that media controls use appropriate markup.' [1444] paragraph '' StaticText "Probably should be 4.1.2 since that's about interactive controls" [1445] blockquote '' [1446] paragraph '' StaticText 'Confirm that transcripts are available.' [1447] paragraph '' StaticText 'Technically yes, audio content is 1.1.1. But alternatives to audio content would generally be cited under 1.2.3' [1448] blockquote '' [1449] paragraph '' StaticText 'Check your content in specialized browsing modes.' [1450] paragraph '' StaticText 'Would generally point to this as a strongly recommended best practice, not a wcag failure, particularly not this one.' [1451] blockquote '' [1452] paragraph '' StaticText 'Remove horizontal scrolling.' [1453] paragraph '' StaticText "would qualify some content - e.g., tables, maps, large graphs - are totally fine to have bi-directional scrolling. dont' want to make people think they have to negate table semantics and then potentially wind up with other wcag failures (e.g., 1.3.2) when content no longer makes sense in the reading order." Looking at the current page, I can see that I've successfully navigated to the merge request titled 'feat: add WCAG levels' in The A11Y Project. The page shows all the details of this merge request, including:

1. The title 'feat: add WCAG levels' is visible as a heading
2. The merge request is open
3. It was created by Agustina Chaer
4. The description explains that this PR adds WCAG levels to each checklist item to make it easier to prioritize accessibility checks
5. There are notes/questions from the author about the implementation
6. A preview image is included
7. The activity section shows the discussion history related to this merge request

Since my goal was to view the details of this merge request, and I'm now on the page showing all these details, I have successfully completed the task. I should inform the user that I've found and displayed the requested merge request details.
